name: Document
description: Displaying an external document like PDF, TXT or DOCX.

params.name: src
params.description: The source file to read the data from. This must be provided if records is not provided.

params.name: buffer
params.description: Document data buffer. Recommended to use `src` instead unless you want to use a string.

params.name: base64
params.description: Base64 encoded string of the document data. Mutually exclusive with `src` and `buffer`.

params.name: parser
params.description: The parser to use for reading the data. If not provided, it will be inferred from the file extension.

params.name: multimedia
params.description: If true, the multimedias will be displayed. If false, the alt strings will be displayed at best effort. Default is `true`.

params.name: selectedPages
params.description:
The pages to be selected. This is only available **for PDF documents**. If not provided, all pages will be selected.
You can use a string like `2` to specify a single page, or slice like `2:4` to specify a range of pages (2 inclusive, 4 exclusive).
The pages selected are **0-indexed**. Negative indexes like `-1` is not supported here.

example:
To display a Word document without including the real multimedia:
```xml
<Document src="sample.docx" multimedia="false"/>
```

name: Role
description:
Specifies the role you want the language model to assume when responding.
Defining a role provides the model with a perspective or context,
such as a scientist, poet, child, or any other persona you choose.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the role paragraph. Default is `Role`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `role`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

name: Task
description:
Task represents the action you want the language model to perform.
It is a directive or instruction that you want the model to follow.
Task is usually not long, but rather a concise and clear statement.
Users can also include a list of steps or instructions to complete the task.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the task paragraph. Default is `Task`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `task`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

example:
```xml
<task>Cook a recipe on how to prepare a beef dish.</task>
```

When including a list of steps:
```xml
<task>
  Planning a schedule for a travel.
  <list>
    <item>Decide on the destination and plan the duration.</item>
    <item>Find useful information about the destination.</item>
    <item>Write down the schedule for each day.</item>
  </list>
</task>
```

name: OutputFormat
description:
Output format deals with the format in which the model should provide the output.
It can be a specific format such as JSON, XML, or CSV, or a general format such as a story,
a diagram or steps of instructions.
Please refrain from specifying too complex formats that the model may not be able to generate,
such as a PDF file or a video.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the output format paragraph. Default is `Output Format`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `outputFormat`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

example:
```xml
<output-format>Respond with a JSON without additional characters or punctuations.</output-format>
```

name: StepwiseInstructions
description:
StepwiseInstructions that elaborates the task by providing a list of steps or instructions.
Each step should be concise and clear, and the list should be easy to follow.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the stepwise instructions paragraph. Default is `Stepwise Instructions`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `stepwiseInstructions`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

example:
```xml
<stepwise-instructions>
  <list>
    <item>Interpret and rewrite user's query.</item>
    <item>Think of a plan to solve the query.</item>
    <item>Generate a response based on the plan.</item>
  </list>
</stepwise-instructions>
```

name: Hint
description:
Hint can be used anywhere in the prompt where you want to provide a helpful tip or explanation.
It is usually a short and concise statement that guides the LLM in the right direction.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the hint paragraph. Default is `Hint`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `hint`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `bold`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionColon
params.description:
Indicates whether to append a colon after the caption.
By default, this is true for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and false otherwise.

example:
```xml
<hint>Alice first purchased 4 apples and then 3 more, so she has 7 apples in total.</hint>
```

name: Introducer
description:
Introducer is a paragraph before a long paragraph (usually a list of examples, steps, or instructions).
It serves as a context introducing what is expected to follow.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the introducer paragraph. Default is `Introducer`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `introducer`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `hidden`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

name: ExampleSet
description:
Example set (`<examples>`) is a collection of examples that are usually presented in a list.
With the example set, you can manage multiple examples under a single title and optionally an introducer,
as well as the same `chat` format.
You can also choose to use `<example>` purely without example set.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the example set paragraph. Default is `Examples`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `examples`.

params.name: chat
params.description:
Indicates whether the examples should be rendered in chat format.
By default, it's `true` for "markup" syntaxes and `false` for "serializer" syntaxes.

params.name: introducer
params.description:
An optional introducer text to be displayed before the examples.
For example, `Here are some examples:`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

example:
```xml
<examples chat={{true}}>
  <example>
    <input>What is the capital of France?</input>
    <output>Paris</output>
  </example>
  <example>
    <input>What is the capital of Germany?</input>
    <output>Berlin</output>
  </example>
</examples>
```

name: Example
description:
Example is useful for providing a context, helping the model to understand what kind of inputs and outputs are expected.
It can also be used to demonstrate the desired output style, clarifying the structure, tone, or level of detail in the response.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the example paragraph. Default is `Example`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `example`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `hidden`.
Options include `header`, `bold`, `plain`, or `hidden`.

params.name: chat
params.description:
Indicates whether the example should be rendered in chat format.
When used in a example set (`<examples>`), this is inherited from the example set.
Otherwise, it defaults to `false` for "serializer" syntaxes and `true` for "markup" syntaxes.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description:
Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes.
Options are `upper`, `lower`, `capitalize`, or `none`. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionColon
params.description:
Indicates whether to append a colon after the caption.
By default, this is true for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and false otherwise.

example:
```xml
<example>
  <input>What is the capital of France?</input>
  <output>Paris</output>
</example>
```

```xml
<task>Summarize the following passage in a single sentence.</task>
<example>
  <input caption="Passage">The sun provides energy for life on Earth through processes like photosynthesis.</input>
  <output caption="Summary">The sun is essential for energy and life processes on Earth.</output>
</example>
```

name: ExampleInput
description:
ExampleInput (`<input>`) is a paragraph that represents an example input.
By default, it's spoken by a human speaker in a chat context, but you can manually specify the speaker.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the example input paragraph. Default is `Input`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `input`.

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker for the example input. Default is `human` if chat context is enabled (see `<example>`).

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `hidden` if chat context is enabled. Otherwise, it's `bold`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionColon
params.description:
Indicates whether to append a colon after the caption.
By default, this is true for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and false otherwise.

example:
```xml
<input>What is the capital of France?</input>
```

When used with a template:

```xml
<input>What is the capital of {{country}}?</input>
```

name: ExampleOutput
description:
ExampleOutput (`<output>`) is a paragraph that represents an example output.
By default, it's spoken by a AI speaker in a chat context, but you can manually specify the speaker.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the example output paragraph. Default is `Output`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `output`.

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker for the example output. Default is `ai` if chat context is enabled (see `<example>`).

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `hidden` if chat context is enabled. Otherwise, it's `bold`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionColon
params.description:
Indicates whether to append a colon after the caption.
By default, this is true for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and false otherwise.

example:
```xml
<output>The capital of France is Paris.</output>
```

When used with a template:

```xml
<output>The capital of {{country}} is {{capital}}.</output>
```

name: Question
description:
Question (`<qa>`) is actually a combination of a question and a prompt for the answer.
It's usually used at the end of a prompt to ask a question.
The question is followed by a prompt for answer (e.g., `Answer:`) to guide the model to respond.

params.name: questionCaption
params.description: The title or label for the question paragraph. Default is `Question`.

params.name: answerCaption
params.description: The title or label for the answer paragraph. Default is `Answer`.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description: The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes. Default is `question`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `bold`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

name: SystemMessage
description: Wrap the contents in a system message.

name: HumanMessage
description: Wrap the contents in a user message.

name: AiMessage
description: Wrap the contents in a AI message.

name: MessageContent
description: Display a message content.

params.name: content
params.description: The content of the message. It can be a string, or an array of strings and multimedia content.

example:
```xml
<msg-content content="What is the capital of France?" />
```

name: Conversation
description: Display a conversation between system, human and AI.

params.name: messages
params.description: A list of message. Each message should have a `speaker` and a `content` field.

params.name: selectedMessages
params.description:
The messages to be selected. If not provided, all messages will be selected.
You can use a string like `2` to specify a single message, or slice like `2:4` to specify a range of messages (2 inclusive, 4 exclusive).
Or use `-6:` to select the last 6 messages.

example:
```xml
<conversation messages="{{[{ speaker: 'human', content: 'What is the capital of France?' }, { speaker: 'ai', content: 'Paris' }]}}" />
```

name: Table
description: Displaying a table with records and columns.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The output syntax of the content.

params.name: records
params.description: A list, each element is an object / dictionary / list of elements. The keys are the fields and the values are the data in cells.

params.name: columns
params.description:
A list of column definitions. Each column definition is an object with keys "field", "header", and "description".
The field is the key in the record object, the header is displayed in the top row, and the description is meant to be an explanation.
Columns are optional. If not provided, the columns are inferred from the records.

params.name: src
params.description: The source file to read the data from. This must be provided if records is not provided.

params.name: parser
params.description: The parser to use for reading the data. If not provided, it will be inferred from the file extension.

params.name: selectedColumns
params.description:
The selected columns to display. If not provided, all columns will be displayed.
It should be an array of column field names, e.g. `["name", "age"]`; or a string like `2:4` to select columns 2 (inclusive) to 4 (exclusive).
There is a special column name called `index` which is the enumeration of the records starting from 0.
You can also use a special value called `+index` to add the index column to the original table.

params.name: selectedRecords
params.description:
The selected records to display. If not provided, all records will be displayed.
It should be an array of record indices, e.g. `[0, 1]`; or a string like `2:4` to select records 2 (inclusive) to 4 (exclusive).

params.name: maxRecords
params.description: The maximum number of records to display. If not provided, all records will be displayed.

params.name: maxColumns
params.description: The maximum number of columns to display. If not provided, all columns will be displayed.

example:
```xml
<table records="{{[{ name: 'Alice', age: 20 }, { name: 'Bob', age: 30 }]}}" />
```

To import an excel file, and display the first 10 records in csv syntax:

```xml
<table src="data.xlsx" parser="excel" maxRecords="10" syntax="csv" />
```

name: Tree
description: Renders a tree structure in various formats.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The output syntax to use for rendering the tree

params.name: items
params.description: Array of tree items to render

params.name: showContent
params.description: Whether to show content values of tree items

name: Folder
description: Displays a directory structure as a tree.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The output syntax of the content.

params.name: src
params.description: The source directory path to display.

params.name: data
params.description: Alternative to src, directly provide tree data structure.

params.name: filter
params.description:
A regular expression to filter files.
  The regex is applied to the folder names and file names (not the full path).
  Directories are included by default unless all of their nested content is filtered out.
  When filter is on, empty directories will not be shown.

params.name: maxDepth
params.description: Maximum depth of directory traversal. Default is 3.

params.name: showContent
params.description: Whether to show file contents. Default is false.

example:
To display a directory structure with a filter for Python files:
```xml
<folder src="project_dir" filter=".*\.py$" maxDepth="3" />
```

name: CaptionedParagraph
description: CaptionedParagraph (`<cp>` for short) creates a paragraph with a customized caption title.

params.name: caption
params.description: The title or label for the paragraph. Required.

params.name: captionSerialized
params.description:
The serialized version of the caption when using "serializer" syntaxes.
  By default, it's same as `caption`.

params.name: captionStyle
params.description:
Determines the style of the caption,
applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `header`.

params.name: captionTextTransform
params.description: Specifies text transformation for the caption, applicable only for "markup" syntaxes. Default is `none`.

params.name: captionEnding
params.description:
A caption can ends with a colon, a newline or simply nothing.
If not specified, it defaults to `colon` for `bold` or `plain` captionStyle, and `none` otherwise.

example:
```xml
<cp caption="Constraints">
  <list>
    <item>Do not exceed 1000 tokens.</item>
    <item>Please use simple words.</item>
  </list>
</cp>
```

name: Webpage
description: Displays content from a webpage.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL of the webpage to fetch and display.

params.name: src
params.description: Local file path to an HTML file to display.

params.name: buffer
params.description: HTML content as string or buffer.

params.name: base64
params.description: Base64 encoded HTML content.

params.name: extractText
params.description: Whether to extract plain text content (true) or convert HTML to structured POML (false). Default is false.

params.name: selector
params.description: CSS selector to extract specific content from the page (e.g., "article", ".content", "#main"). Default is "body".

example:
Display content from a URL:
```xml
<webpage url="https://example.com" />
```

Extract only specific content using a selector:
```xml
<webpage url="https://example.com" selector="main article" />
```

Convert HTML to structured POML components:
```xml
<webpage url="https://example.com" extractText="false" />
```

name: Text
description:
Text (`<text>`, `<poml>`) is a wrapper for any contents.
By default, it uses `markdown` syntax and writes the contents within it directly to the output.
When used with "markup" syntaxes, it renders a standalone section preceded and followed by one blank line.
It's mostly used in the root element of a prompt, but it should also work in any other places.
This component will be automatically added as a wrapping root element if it's not provided:
1. If the first element is pure text contents, `<poml syntax="text">` will be added.
2. If the first element is a POML component, `<poml syntax="markdown">` will be added.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The syntax of the content. Note `xml` and `text` are experimental.

params.name: className
params.description: A class name for quickly styling the current block with stylesheets.

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker of the content. By default, it's determined by the context and the content.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the content, used in serialization.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the content, used in serialization.

params.name: writerOptions
params.description: **Experimental.**. Optional JSON string to customize the format of markdown headers, JSON indents, etc.

params.name: whiteSpace
charLimit
params.description: **Experimental.** Soft character limit before truncation is applied. Content exceeding this limit will be truncated with a marker.

params.name: tokenLimit
params.description: **Experimental.** Soft token limit before truncation is applied. Content exceeding this limit will be truncated with a marker.

params.name: priority
params.description: **Experimental.** Priority used when truncating globally. Lower numbers are dropped first when content needs to be reduced to fit limits.

example:
```xml Contents of the whole prompt. 1. Your customized list. 2. You don't need to know anything about POML. ``` To render the whole prompt in markdown syntax with a "human" speaker: ```xml

You are a helpful assistant.

What is the capital of France?

 ``` **Experimental usage with limits and priority:** ```xml

This has lower priority and may be truncated first.

This has higher priority and will be preserved longer.

 ```

name: Paragraph
description:
Paragraph (`

`) is a standalone section preceded by and followed by two blank lines in markup syntaxes. It's mostly used for text contents.

params.name: blankLine
params.description: Whether to add one more blank line (2 in total) before and after the paragraph.

name: Inline
description:
Inline (`<span>`) is a container for inline content.
When used with markup syntaxes, it wraps text in an inline style, without any preceding or following blank characters.
In serializer syntaxes, it's treated as a generic value.
Inline elements are not designed to be used alone (especially in serializer syntaxes).
One might notice problematic renderings (e.g., speaker not applied) when using it alone.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The syntax of the content.

params.name: className
params.description: A class name for quickly styling the current block with stylesheets.

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker of the content. By default, it's determined by the context and the content.

params.name: writerOptions
params.description: **Experimental.**. Optional JSON string to customize the format of markdown headers, JSON indents, etc.

params.name: whiteSpace
charLimit
params.description: **Experimental.** Soft character limit before truncation is applied. Content exceeding this limit will be truncated with a marker.

params.name: tokenLimit
params.description: **Experimental.** Soft token limit before truncation is applied. Content exceeding this limit will be truncated with a marker.

params.name: priority
params.description: **Experimental.** Priority used when truncating globally. Lower numbers are dropped first when content needs to be reduced to fit limits.

name: Newline
description:
Newline (`
`) explicitly adds a line break, primarily in markup syntaxes. In serializer syntaxes, it's ignored.

params.name: newLineCount
params.description: The number of linebreaks to add.

name: Header
description:
Header (`<h>`) renders headings in markup syntaxes.
It's commonly used to highlight titles or section headings.
The header level will be automatically computed based on the context.
Use SubContent (`<section>`) for nested content.

name: SubContent
description:
SubContent (`<section>`) renders nested content, often following a header.
The headers within the section will be automatically adjusted to a lower level.

name: Bold
description: Bold (`<b>`) emphasizes text in a bold style when using markup syntaxes.

name: Italic
description: Italic (`<i>`) emphasizes text in an italic style when using markup syntaxes.

name: Strikethrough
description: Strikethrough (`<s>`, `<strike>`) indicates removed or invalid text in markup syntaxes.

name: Underline
description: Underline (`<u>`) draws a line beneath text in markup syntaxes.

name: Code
description: Code is used to represent code snippets or inline code in markup syntaxes.

params.name: inline
params.description: Whether to render code inline or as a block. Default is `true`.

params.name: lang
params.description: The language of the code snippet.

name: List
description:
List (`<list>`) is a container for multiple ListItem (`<item>`) elements.
When used with markup syntaxes, a bullet or numbering is added.

params.name: listStyle
params.description: The style for the list marker, such as dash or star. Default is `dash`.

name: ListItem
description:
ListItem (`<item>`) is an item within a List component.
In markup mode, it is rendered with the specified bullet or numbering style.

name: Object
description:
DataObject (`<obj>`, `<object>`, `<dataObj>`) displays external data or object content.
When in serialize mode, it's serialized according to the given serializer.

params.name: syntax
params.description: The syntax or serializer of the content. Default is `json`.

params.name: data
params.description: The data object to render.

name: Image
description: Image (``) displays an image in the content. Alternatively, it can also be shown as an alt text by specifying the `syntax` prop. Note that syntax must be specified as `multimedia` to show the image.

params.name: src
params.description: The path or URL to the image file.

params.name: alt
params.description: The alternative text to show when the image cannot be displayed.

params.name: base64
params.description: The base64 encoded image data. It can not be specified together with `src`.

params.name: type
params.description:
The MIME type of the image **to be shown**. If not specified, it will be inferred from the file extension.
  If specified, the image will be converted to the specified type. Can be `image/jpeg`, `image/png`, etc., or without the `image/` prefix.

params.name: position
params.description: The position of the image. Default is `here`.

params.name: maxWidth
params.description: The maximum width of the image to be shown.

params.name: maxHeight
params.description: The maximum height of the image to be shown.

params.name: resize
params.description: The ratio to resize the image to to be shown.

params.name: syntax
params.description:
Only when specified as `multimedia`, the image will be shown.
  Otherwise, the alt text will be shown. By default, it's `multimedia` when `alt` is not specified. Otherwise, it's undefined (inherit from parent).

name: Audio
description:
Audio (`<audio>`) embeds an audio file in the content.

Accepts either a file path (`src`) or base64-encoded audio data (`base64`).
The MIME type can be provided via `type` or will be inferred from the file extension.

params.name: src
params.description: Path to the audio file. If provided, the file will be read and encoded as base64.

params.name: base64
params.description: Base64-encoded audio data. Cannot be used together with `src`.

params.name: alt
params.description: The alternative text to show when the image cannot be displayed.

params.name: type
params.description:
The MIME type of the audio (e.g., audio/mpeg, audio/wav). If not specified, it will be inferred from the file extension.
  The type must be consistent with the real type of the file. The consistency will NOT be checked or converted.
  The type can be specified with or without the `audio/` prefix.

params.name: position
params.description: The position of the image. Default is `here`.

params.name: syntax
params.description:
Only when specified as `multimedia`, the image will be shown.
  Otherwise, the alt text will be shown. By default, it's `multimedia` when `alt` is not specified. Otherwise, it's undefined (inherit from parent).

name: ToolRequest
description:
ToolRequest represents an AI-generated tool request with parameters.
Used to display tool calls made by AI models.

params.name: id
params.description: Tool request ID

params.name: name
params.description: Tool name

params.name: parameters
params.description: Tool input parameters

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker of the content. Default is `ai`.

name: ToolResponse
description:
ToolResponse represents the result of a tool execution.
Used to display tool execution results with rich content.

params.name: syntax
params.description:
The syntax of ToolResponse is special.
  It is always `multimedia` for itself. The syntax is used to render the content inside.
  If not specified, it will inherit from the parent context.

params.name: id
params.description: Tool call ID to respond to

params.name: name
params.description: Tool name

params.name: speaker
params.description: The speaker of the content. Default is `tool`.
